intro: Psychotria terepaimensis, commonly known as the Colombian Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria terepaimensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though research on its properties remains limited.
